NexStar 4 SE client v0.1

0.1

Introduction

This project intends to comunicate with a Celestron's NexStar4 SE telescope. When run on a host machine, it opens a serial port to communicate with the the telescope and pass it some commands.

This application was developed for testing the telescope RS232 serial communication protocol. This is part of the Telescope Control System (TCS) being developed at Universidad Técnica Federico Santa María, in Valparaiso, Chile, which is part of the CSAT project.

Usage

To use the simulator just go to the src directory and run make. The sim_nex4 executable file should be created at the bin directory. By default it listens to the first serial port /dev/ttyS0. You can change this behavior by passing the desired device file as a command-line argument:

./cli_nex4 <device_file>

Be aware that you will need R/W permission on any device file to be used.

See also:
NexStar Communication Protocol v 1.2.
